text: Has anyone had any success trying to block web copiers from cloning your site?
like <https://www.httrack.com/> for example
I know i can add a disallow on the robots.txt level but these tools have options to ignore this so the only options would be on the server level which we don't have access to

When we or clients are using tools like AHREFs, we’ve noticed that sometimes the cookie blocking JS file 404's across the entire site. It appears transitory and then comes back after a while.

```https://****.com/_hcms/cookie-banner/auto-blocking.js?portalId=://****.&domain=://****.```
Does anyone else see that? It’s happened to a few clients now.

Is there a way to make the CMS site search index refresh? I've got a HubDB dynamic page that was previously set up with child tables. Those were removed a while ago, but the child URLs are still showing up in search.

Hi Ian,

I hope you are well this fine Tuesday.

While there still doesn't appear to be in-built functionality for this, I have found success in the past by rebuilding the page after clearing the site cache. Other options include filing a reindexing request via <https://search.google.com/search-console/welcome?utm_source=about-page|Google Search Console here> or asking HubSpot to take a peek over on <https://help.HubSpot.com/|their help portal here>.

I hope this helps! :slightly_smiling_face:

Hi everyone, we recently experienced a problem with your Node JS API and we need help with resolving the issue.

The following line:

`const apiResponse = await HubSpotClient.files.filesApi.getSignedUrl(fileId, size, expirationSeconds, upscale);`

is working fine for documents not marked as sensitive. However, for the ones marked as sensitive, it's causing the following error to occur:

`ApiException [Error]: HTTP-Code: 404`

The `filed` is 112892509882 and the rest of the parameters are set to `undefined`.

I attached the response we get back for more info.

Tagging you for info <@U07J2NXN5M0>

Hi <@U07J9RL4PRV>,

Hope you're having a great day.

Taking a quick look at this, it looks like the most likely cause is due to you having a generalised configuration. Sensitive data in HubSpot is handled differently to regular data (for all the reasons you might expect) and needs different app scopes and authorisation during retrieval.

You can find all the information you need in the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/sensitive-data#retrieve-sensitive-data-properties|Developer Docs which includes how to retrieve sensitive data properties using the right parameters>.

I hope this helps! :slightly_smiling_face:

As a quick addition, it's worth noting that as this is a BETA feature, sometimes things can get a bit stuck in the woodwork, if you follow the above documentation and hit a wall, it's probably best to <https://help.HubSpot.com/|contact HubSpot directly via their help portal> as it wouldn't be ideal for you to be sharing any sensitive data procedures in a public forum like this.
<https://downdetector.in/status/HubSpot/>
Hey folks - we're aware of issues with accessing HubSpot that some folks are having. Our team is on it, and a status update should be coming soon here <https://status.HubSpot.com/>

:orange_heart:*Please take a moment to review our Code of Conduct*:orange_heart:

We want the HubSpot Developer community to be inclusive and welcoming. By following our Code of Conduct, you can help ensure that's the case.

TL;DR:
• Be respectful
• Be inclusive (try not to say, "Hey guys, hey boys, hey [any specific group]")
• No self promotion, except for <#C0121KGC6RM|showcase> and <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs> 
• No unsolicited DMs
Read the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/slack/code-of-conduct|whole thing here> - and thanks for being a part of the HubSpot Developer Community!

Want to report a violation? DM <@UQNEXHW14> or fill out the <https://form.asana.com/?k=p7aM0fpd3G4JGETDL_nYXg&d=8587152060687|anonymous form here>.

Piggybacking on this just in case anyone is curious to note that Cloudflare has a number of re-routes in place at the moment including issues with their WARP and Case Management services. The latter probably affecting response ability in various regions.

Pouring one out for both teams in the hopes that the ancient computer spirits play kindly and fix quickly. :pouring_liquid:
we're back in
Don’t know if it helps, but if this issue stays unresolved, maybe you could use Import API to update your deals in batch ?

Hello <@U06K19BGMNE>, thank you for this but support got us disappointing feedback.... If you merge deals you get a new ID and the old id is only valid if:
1. You visit directly in url old ID you will be redirected to new ID
2. Apparently only single endpoint API-s ( getDealById, UpdateDeal,...) you can use old ID
Why would you merge deals ?
Our support and sales persons....
Oh ok, what you’re saying is that using ImportAPI instead of batch update you wouldn’t be able to use the Old ID ? Got it.
Right
It will silently fail, gives 200 code but results are empty

Just in case anyone hasn't seen or didn't sub to the notifications, we've got the all-clear. Thanks :HubSpot: team!

<https://status.HubSpot.com/>

OH !
Just for my own knowledge, I tried something and you might be interested by the result :
Had 2 deals that I merged into one. It created a new ID as you said.
Tried to import a file (update only) with only old ID. As a preview HubSpot gave me an error, but I when through, andddd IT WORKED !
I don’t know why it only took the first line though, but it worked.
Meaning that IMPORT API should also work using old IDs
I am gonna try this with a couple of days of delay after merge, I think indexing of old IDs still has mapping. Thank you for the idea!

Sounds like you might have multiple user/team views that have different card display and where some have conditional display on them: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/object-settings/customize-records>

Here's a screenshot of me editing the "Default View" and when there, editing the 'About this contact' card and showing the "Conditional display logic" of that card.

Hey Jolly,

Your issue is likely that you haven't added a Secret to the custom coded action, nor have you edited the code to match the expected secret value.

1. First, You add a secret in the UI (it's blank in your screenshot). The value should be from a private app - <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/private-apps#:~:text=Create%20a%20private%20app,Click%20Create%20private%20app>.
2. Then, You edit the secret name in the code on line 15 - <https://github.com/HubSpot/sample-workflow-custom-code/blob/main/samples/dedupe_contact.js>
That Secret and secret value provide authorized API access to your HubSpot account data
Hi all - where should I ask questions about webhooks? I am assuming <#C2YHAHB6K|api> but would be helpful to know if that's not the right place :slightly_smiling_face:
Does anybody know if I can create a custom regex validation for a form field?
